channel.title: Hand Of Pod
channel.description: The English-language Argentine football podcast. Fuelled by fernet since 2010.

item.title: Episode 370: A familiar duo in the top two places
item.dc:creator: Sam Kelly

On this week’s Hand Of Pod, Sam, English Dan, Andrés and Tony look back on … Continue reading Episode 370: A familiar duo in the top two places →
item.content:encoded:
Want to watch the Superliga and Copa Argentina? Take advantage of a seven-day free trial followed by a 20% discount for your first three months with Fanatiz by following this link and using the discount code hopfz when you sign up!

On this week’s Hand Of Pod, Sam, English Dan, Andrés and Tony look back on a weekend of action which saw River Plate maintain their three-point lead at the top of the table, while Boca Juniors took advantage of Argentinos Juniors’ slip-up to go second. The Primera Femenina restarts this coming weekend so we give you an update on that, and there’s lots more besides.

You can follow HOP in various ways. We have a Facebook page, and a Twitter page. You can subscribe on iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher or TuneIn. And if you’d like to help support the pod financially, you can find us on Patreon.

item.content:encoded:
Want to watch the Superliga and Copa Argentina? Take advantage of a seven-day free trial followed by a 20% discount for your first three months with Fanatiz by following this link and using the discount code hopfz when you sign up!

This week’s Hand Of Pod sees Sam, Andrés, English Dan and Julian review the seventeenth round of Superliga action, which was the first of the new year. Julian runs the rule over Boca Juniors’ summer, Andrés enjoyed a nervy but satisfying win for River in Mendoza (just for a change) and there was frustration for Dan’s Racing under new boss Sebastián Beccacece.

You can follow HOP in various ways. We have a Facebook page, and a Twitter page. You can subscribe on iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher or TuneIn. And if you’d like to help support the pod financially, you can find us on Patreon.

item.title: Episode 368: Back to business

In the first Hand Of Pod of 2020, Sam, English Dan, Tony and Andrés preview … Continue reading Episode 368: Back to business →
item.content:encoded:
Want to watch the Superliga and Copa Argentina? Take advantage of a seven-day free trial followed by a 20% discount for your first three months with Fanatiz by following this link and using the discount code hopfz when you sign up!

In the first Hand Of Pod of 2020, Sam, English Dan, Tony and Andrés preview this weekend’s return to Superliga action as the summer break comes to a close. Why are River Plate unhappy with kit suppliers adidas? Will Daniele De Rossi ever truly retire? How much longer will the Superliga be around for? All these questions and more are considered this week.

You can follow HOP in various ways. We have a Facebook page, and a Twitter page. You can subscribe on iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher or TuneIn. And if you’d like to help support the pod financially, you can find us on Patreon.

item.title: Episode 365: Getting up to date on the last couple of weeks
item.dc:creator: Sam Kelly
item.description: Hand Of Pod is back after Sam’s holiday, and in this week’s episode, English Dan, Andrés and Tony fill him in on what’s been happening while he was away, including a review of River Plate’s late collapse in the Copa Libertadores final, why Diego Maradona resigned and then unresigned as Gimnasia manager, and the main … Continue reading Episode 365: Getting up to date on the last couple of weeks →
item.content:encoded:
Hand Of Pod is back after Sam’s holiday, and in this week’s episode, English Dan, Andrés and Tony fill him in on what’s been happening while he was away, including a review of River Plate’s late collapse in the Copa Libertadores final, why Diego Maradona resigned and then unresigned as Gimnasia manager, and the main talking points ahead of Boca Juniors’ presidential election on Sunday.

Want to watch the Superliga and Copa Argentina? Take advantage of a seven-day free trial followed by a 20% discount for your first three months with Fanatiz by following this link and using the discount code hopfz when you sign up!

You can follow HOP in various ways. We have a Facebook page, and a Twitter page. You can subscribe on iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher or TuneIn. And if you’d like to help support the pod financially, you can find us on Patreon.

item.title: Episode 364: Previewing the 2019 Copa Libertadores final
item.dc:creator: Sam Kelly
item.description: This Saturday, the first ever single-match final of South America’s biggest club competition will be played, as holders River Plate take on Brazilian giants Flamengo in Lima’s Estadio Monumental. In this week’s Hand Of Pod – recorded last Thursday, because Sam is away on holiday – Sam and Andrés take you through both sides’ route … Continue reading Episode 364: Previewing the 2019 Copa Libertadores final →
item.content:encoded:
This Saturday, the first ever single-match final of South America’s biggest club competition will be played, as holders River Plate take on Brazilian giants Flamengo in Lima’s Estadio Monumental. In this week’s Hand Of Pod – recorded last Thursday, because Sam is away on holiday – Sam and Andrés take you through both sides’ route to the final, and consider what might happen on Saturday afternoon.

Want to watch the Superliga and Copa Argentina? Take advantage of a seven-day free trial followed by a 20% discount for your first three months with Fanatiz by following this link and using the discount code hopfz when you sign up!

You can follow HOP in various ways. We have a Facebook page, and a Twitter page. You can subscribe on iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher or TuneIn. And if you’d like to help support the pod financially, you can find us on Patreon.

item.title: Episode 363: No one at the top wants to win, and looking forward to Argentina v Brazil
item.dc:creator: Sam Kelly
item.description: In this week’s Hand Of Pod, Sam and Andrés look back on a weekend of Superliga action which saw all of the top four drop points (Boca Juniors were the only ones to even draw), ensuring a tight title race has got even tighter due to wins for a few of the chasing pack. We … Continue reading Episode 363: No one at the top wants to win, and looking forward to Argentina v Brazil →
item.content:encoded:
In this week’s Hand Of Pod, Sam and Andrés look back on a weekend of Superliga action which saw all of the top four drop points (Boca Juniors were the only ones to even draw), ensuring a tight title race has got even tighter due to wins for a few of the chasing pack. We also consider the Copa Argentina semi-finals, one of which was played during and one of which was played after this recording (the final will pit Central Córdoba de Santiago del Estero against River Plate), and look forward to Friday’s friendly between Argentina and Brazil, which is being played as I upload this episode.

Want to watch the Superliga and Copa Argentina? Take advantage of a seven-day free trial followed by a 20% discount for your first three months with Fanatiz by following this link and using the discount code hopfz when you sign up!

You can follow HOP in various ways. We have a Facebook page, and a Twitter page. You can subscribe on iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher or TuneIn. And if you’d like to help support the pod financially, you can find us on Patreon.

item.title: Episode 362: The title race tightens up, and Estudiantes’ new stadium is close
item.dc:creator: Sam Kelly
item.description: In this week’s Hand Of Pod, Sam, Andrés and Tony are again joined by special guests Phil and Jamie to discuss a weekend in which victories for River Plate, Boca Juniors and Lanús combined with a draw for Argentinos Juniors to leave four teams separated by just a point at the top of the table. … Continue reading Episode 362: The title race tightens up, and Estudiantes’ new stadium is close →
item.content:encoded:
In this week’s Hand Of Pod, Sam, Andrés and Tony are again joined by special guests Phil and Jamie to discuss a weekend in which victories for River Plate, Boca Juniors and Lanús combined with a draw for Argentinos Juniors to leave four teams separated by just a point at the top of the table. As well as this, Colón take on Independiente Del Valle in the Copa Sudamericana final on Saturday, and on that same day Estudiantes open their new stadium – although with a party rather than a match, because they host Talleres in the municipal stadium on Friday night.

Want to watch the Superliga and Copa Argentina? Take advantage of a seven-day free trial followed by a 20% discount for your first three months with Fanatiz by following this link and using the discount code hopfz when you sign up!

You can follow HOP in various ways. We have a Facebook page, and a Twitter page. You can subscribe on iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher or TuneIn. And if you’d like to help support the pod financially, you can find us on Patreon.

item.title: Episode 361: A visit from two special guests as Argentinos go clear at the top and River go third
item.dc:creator: Sam Kelly
item.description: This week in the Hand Of Pod studio, Sam, English Dan and Andrés are joined by two very special guests: Phil Carney, who runs the Lanús in English Twitter account, and Jamie Ralph, who runs the Newell’s in English account, are both visiting Argentina for a couple of weeks, and came in to say hello. … Continue reading Episode 361: A visit from two special guests as Argentinos go clear at the top and River go third →
item.content:encoded:
This week in the Hand Of Pod studio, Sam, English Dan and Andrés are joined by two very special guests: Phil Carney, who runs the Lanús in English Twitter account, and Jamie Ralph, who runs the Newell’s in English account, are both visiting Argentina for a couple of weeks, and came in to say hello. With them, we review a midweek round of Superliga action which saw Argentinos Juniors go clear at the top, and River Plate go third – with Lanús, whose win over Boca Juniors was watched by Phil, and helped both of those clubs to climb the table, sitting between them. Jamie’s first trip to the Estadio Marcelo Bielsa didn’t go quite as well: Newell’s were tonked by Diego Maradona’s Gimnasia, who might be allowing themselves to dream of survival after all …

Want to watch the Superliga and Copa Argentina? Take advantage of a seven-day free trial followed by a 20% discount for your first three months with Fanatiz by following this link and using the discount code hopfz when you sign up!

You can follow HOP in various ways. We have a Facebook page, and a Twitter page. You can subscribe on iTunes, Spotify, Stitcher or TuneIn. And if you’d like to help support the pod financially, you can find us on Patreon.
